block.p: Lilly Farahnakian, was married last evening to James Reuben Copland IV. The Rev. Dr. Ronald A. Rinn performed the ceremony at the Augsburg Lutheran Church in Winston-Salem, N.C.
Mr. and Mrs. Copland, both 28, are graduates of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where they met and where both were Morehead scholars. They received law degrees from Yale.
Lilly Farahnakian, was married last evening to James Reuben Copland IV. The Rev. Dr. Ronald A. Rinn performed the ceremony at the Augsburg Lutheran Church in Winston-Salem, N.C.
Mr. and Mrs. Copland, both 28, are graduates of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where they met and where both were Morehead scholars. They received law degrees from Yale.

The bride is an associate in litigation at Willkie, Farr & Gallagher, the New York law firm. The bridegroom was until June a law clerk for Chief Judge Ralph K. Winter of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, in New York. In November, he is to become an associate in the New York office of McKinsey & Company, consultants.
The bride is the daughter of Azame Farahnakian and Dr. Ali Farahnakian of Bermuda Run, N.C. Her father is the chief radiologist for Stokes-Reynolds Memorial Hospital in Danbury, N.C.

The bridegroom also received a master's degree in international political economy from the London School of Economics and an M.B.A. from Yale. He is a son of Harriett Copland and Mr. Copland III of Burlington, N.C. His father is the president and treasurer of Copland Fabrics and Copland Industries, textile manufacturers in Hopedale, N.C.
